dublinCore.dc:title: 119 S1256 IS: Fire Island AIDS Memorial Establishment Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mrs. Gillibrand (for herself and Mr. Schumer) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

form.official-title: To authorize the Pines Foundation to establish the Fire Island AIDS Memorial, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Fire Island AIDS Memorial Establishment Act.
The purposes of the Act are—

paragraph.text: to honor and remember the many residents of Fire Island Pines and Cherry Grove, New York, who suffered and died from the AIDS epidemic; and
to educate future generations about the AIDS epidemic and the impact of the AIDS epidemic on the Fire Island communities in the State of New York.
The term Foundation means the Pines Foundation, a tax-exempt organization affiliated with the Fire Island Pines Property Owners’ Association.
The term Memorial means the Fire Island AIDS Memorial authorized to be established under section 4(a).
The term Secretary means the Secretary of the Interior.

subsection.text: Subject to subsection (c) and any terms and conditions the Secretary considers appropriate, the Foundation may establish and maintain a memorial within the boundaries of Fire Island National Seashore to honor the residents of Fire Island who died of AIDS, to be known as the Fire Island AIDS Memorial.
Federal funds may not be used to design, procure, prepare, install, or maintain the Memorial.
The design and location of the Memorial shall be subject to the approval of the Secretary.
